intro: Ceropegia scutellata subsp. dhofarensis, commonly known as the Dhofar ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to the Arabian Peninsula. It is characterized by its trailing stems and small, tubular flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky surfaces or in sandy soils. It produces small, fleshy leaves that help it conserve water in its native habitat. This subspecies is part of the Apocynaceae family and is known for its unique floral structure and ecological adaptations.
